title.narrative: AENA - Climate Change and livelihood res

description.narrative:
AENA is a grass rooted organization, with high potential of creating impact due its knowledge of operating in local context.
History AENA was founded in 2004 , and in 2006 was recognized as a legal institution. It was registered at the Registries of Nampula under No. 58, sheets 30of the book G- 1 since July 30, 2007 . The motivation for the creation of AENA , is the fact that despite much effort to reduce rural poverty still prevalent problems of social, economic and cultural development of rural communities , especially food and nutritional insecurity, widespread illiteracy, weak citizenship , poor management and unsustainable natural resource governance, gender inequality and no respect for the environment .
Currently has 36 members and is headquartered in the city of Nampula
Overall objective Contribute to the improvement of living standards of rural communities by encouraging local initiatives and promoting sustainable management and governance of natural resources in rural communities.
Specific Strategic Objectives 1. Promote food security, economic and Nutrition ; 2 . Equity and gender equality; 3 . Advocacy and lobbying on Natural Resources and extension ; 4 . Organizational Development geographic Location Headquarters : Nampula City It has activities in three provinces , namely: Districts of Nampula Meconta , Monapo Mogicual , Angoche and Moma - in the districts of Zambezia Pebane , Gile and Ile and Cabo Delgado -Districts Montepuez , Coin and Mocímboa Beach
Member Networks # NB Provincial Agriculture Network and the SC / SC Platform Nampula ; # CIP , and EITI National Platform ; # Academic City in Nampula interested in the management and sustainable governance of NB ;
Actual Partners Sponsors: 1. DANIDA through the Royal Danish Embassy 2 . CARE International 3 . Swedish Cooperative Centre Program through the ACT

participating-org.narrative: AENA is a Mozambican non-governmental organization specializing in supporting sustainable agricultural production, security of landtenure, and promotion of rural women. It will make available its thematic experience (especially on the land issue), its legitimacyas a local organization, and its operational capacity in working with the target group and lobbying. They were created in 2006, dedicated for provide extension services to smallholder farmers in Nampula Province. His large network of extension agriculture technician allowed them to become a reference organization, working with government to support many agriculture projects, related to crops productions and vegetables. In this project, AENA will be active in providing agriculture extensions services to smallholder farmer#s women associations in 3 districts of Nampula province: Ribaue, Malema and Monapo that produce vegetables in sustainable way. Thiswill include, provide technical knowledge (training), and connect the producers with the suppliers and agro dealer (input supplier)and pest control. All the knowledge that they will provide will be base on sustainable techniques and also innovative techniques.The overall, number of women#s associations will be about 80 associations, in resumeabout 1.200 women#s beneficiaries must in 2021 see their vegetables productions increase and have the access to market to increase their revenue and their livelihoods.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
